title: If no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description: When starting a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed and accessing a URL, the server returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content instead of an HTTP error 404. This issue occurs when using the http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip download.
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content instead of an HTTP error 404.
EB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it should return an HTTP error 404 instead of an HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
SR:
1. Download http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance without deploying any webapps
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat server
4. Verify that the server returns an HTTP error 404 instead of an HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
